intro: Dalechampia hispida, commonly known as the rough hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Dalechampia hispida is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and adaptability.
